question_text: A technician installs a PCIe NVMe M.2 SSD but it is not detected. Which of the following is the MOST likely reason?
answer_options: The drive requires UEFI boot and the system uses legacy BIOS
The SATA controller driver is outdated
The drive must be formatted before it's visible
NVMe drives are incompatible with any laptop motherboard
correct_answer: The drive requires UEFI boot and the system uses legacy BIOS
explanation: Some NVMe drives require UEFI firmware to boot properly and won't be detected by legacy BIOS-only systems.
